definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: This fish isn\’t fresh; it smells!
sentences.chinese: 这条鱼不新鲜，已经发臭了。

sentences.english: China is as big, smelly and filthy as I remember it being as a young man traveling abroad.
sentences.chinese: 中国和我年轻时记忆中一样的巨大，发臭和污秽不堪。
这块肉已经腐坏发臭了。

sentences.english: Do not grind knives to rust, water does not flow to stink.
sentences.chinese: 刀不磨要生锈，水不流要发臭。

sentences.english: Fish and guests stink after three days.
sentences.chinese: 鱼和客人都是三天后开始发臭。

sentences.english: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.
sentences.chinese: 因我的愚昧，我的伤发臭流脓。

sentences.english: Guests and fish stink within three days.
sentences.chinese: 鱼放三天会发臭，客呆三天讨人嫌。

sentences.english: My wounds fester and are loathsome because of my sinful folly.
sentences.chinese: 因我的愚昧，我的伤发臭流脓。

sentences.english: The leftover food began to smell bad.
That is, code, like rotting fish, begins to smell over time.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，代码像腐烂的鱼一样开始随着时间发臭。

sentences.english: When the dog needs a bath, he begins to stink.
sentences.chinese: 当那条狗想要入浴的时候，已经开始发臭了。

sentences.english: Fish and visitors smell three days .(
sentences.chinese: 鱼放三天发臭，客住三天讨嫌。

sentences.english: If the combination of gases that make up a fart includes a significant amount of hydrogen sulfide, then it will stink.
sentences.chinese: 如屁的组成气体中包含大量的硫化氢，就会发臭。

sentences.english: The man is stinking with wealth.
Fish and company stink in three days.
sentences.chinese: 鱼放三天发臭，人住三日生嫌。

sentences.english: You need to wash your hair or it will start to smell.
sentences.chinese: 你需要洗头发了，否则它要开始发臭了。
